title.narrative: Public Service Reform and Rejuvenation Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to strengthen and rejuvenate the civil service in selected ministries at the central and provincial levels.

title.narrative: Of which at least 25% are women
New training centers with work plans established and operational
Provincial level Data-dashboards are operational with Citizen Feedback embedded
Mid-career civil servants between 35 and 55 years of age are trained as part of a mid-career program
Pilot provinces with core administrative functions (Finance, Budget, Civil Service, and Planning) established and operational
At provincial Government level in pilot provinces
Cases of irregular civil servants in targeted ministries is resolved
Grievances/Disputes on retirement benefits solved during the retirement process
Civil servants in targeted entities recruited per the new organizational norms and procedures
Rapid Results Initiatives achieving at least 90 percent of the goals set in the performance contract
Percentage of staff who state that they have used the training that they received on the job
of which at least 25 percent are women
Of which at least 25% are women
Young Professionals are trained for both the central and provincial levels as part of a YP program
Civil servants eligible for retirement in the targeted ministries have received their retirement benefits/packages and retired fromactive service
Young professionals employed in the public administration, after completing their training program
Regular Government employees identified and validated through the biometric identification process
